response:
i'm an ai language model, and while i can provide some general possibilities, i can't replace a professional medical evaluation. your symptoms could be due to a variety of conditions, including chronic pancreatitis, gallbladder disease, hepatic disease or even some types of stomach disorders. gastroparesis and gerd themselves can also sometimes cause pain in the upper abdomen, and your medications may have side effects that could potentially contribute as well. 

given your description, the elevated amylase, liver enzymes, and the pancreatic cyst are particularly worth further investigation with your healthcare provider. chronic pancreatitis can cause both abdominal pain and elevated amylase. similarly, liver, gallbladder diseases or liver conditions like fatty liver disease, hepatitis can cause right upper quadrant pain and elevated liver enzymes. finally, although most pancreatic cysts are benign and don't cause symptoms, some can cause abdominal pain. 

remember, it's crucial to discuss these symptoms with your healthcare provider to find the exact cause and appropriate treatment. they may consider further diagnostic tests such as an abdominal ultrasound or endoscopic ultrasound.
